title: TSMC’s Arizona Delay Poses Risk to Biden’s Push for US-Made Chips
description: President Joe Biden risks a major setback to one of his signature legislative achievements after Taiwan’s biggest chipmaker said it was forced to delay production at its marquee project in Arizona, a key battleground state in next year’s election.

title: Mike Pence Scrambles to Make the 2024 Republican Debate
description: Former Vice President Mike Pence’s 2024 campaign is ramping up its digital outreach to Republican donors to avoid the embarrassment of missing the party’s first primary debate next month.

title: House Republicans Push for New Crypto Rules After Ripple Decision
description: Key Republican members of the US House of Representatives formally unveiled a bill to establish rules for oversight of crypto markets in the wake of a recent court ruling that is viewed by some observers as favorable for the sector.

title: Ecuador’s Lasso Seeks to Reform Capital Markets Before Leaving Office
description: Ecuador President Guillermo Lasso plans to issue at least six new legal decrees and seek major changes to the country’s capital market before he leaves office in early December, he said Thursday.

title: Biden Creates Team to Find Ways of Ending Debt-Limit Standoffs
description: President Joe Biden has ordered the creation of a working group to study ways to circumvent future brinkmanship over the US debt limit, months after the nation was taken to the edge of default.

title: Hong Kong Protest Song’s Court Battle Signals More Business Risk
description: Hong Kong’s bid to wipe a controversial protest song from the city’s internet is flashing fresh warnings signs for businesses that the once-freewheeling international hub is tracking closer to mainland rules.

title: Biden Turns to Tech Companies to Police AI Until Congress Acts
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, national security reporter Anna Edgerton looks at the attempts to set up guardrails for artificial intelligence. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Summers Says Tougher US M&A Rules Seem Like ‘War on Business’
description: Former Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers warned that the Biden administration’s crackdown on mergers and acquisitions through a sweeping overhaul of rules the government uses to determine whether deals violate competition law “seems almost like a war on business.”

title: Brazil’s Audit Court Is Likely to Put Braskem Sale on Hold
description: Brazil’s audit court is likely to put the sale of Braskem SA on hold because of an environmental crisis involving the company in the northeastern state of Alagoas, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.

title: Billionaire Jeff Yass Gives $10 Million to Group Seeking Trump Alternative
description: Billionaire Jeff Yass donated $10 million to the super PAC arm of Club for Growth, a pro-business, anti-tax organization that’s looking for an alternative to former President Donald Trump to be the Republican presidential nominee.

title: FBI Document at Heart of Biden Bribery Claims Released by GOP Lawmakers
description: An FBI document released Thursday as evidence of bribes paid by Ukrainian businessmen to President Joe Biden and his son, Hunter, isn’t as clear cut as it has been portrayed by Republican lawmakers.

title: RFK Jr. Alleges ‘Smears’ Are Aimed to Silence His 2024 Presidential Bid
description: Democratic presidential candidate Robert F. Kennedy Jr. told lawmakers he’s being hit by a “new type of censorship” through smears and lies intended to silence him.

title: Thieves in Chile Impersonate President’s Buddy in Brazen Heist
description: Chilean police are investigating the robbery of computers and a safe from a government ministry caught up in a corruption probe, captivating national attention and adding to President Gabriel Boric’s woes.

title: FTC to Pause Microsoft Merger Trial, Opening Door to Settlement Talks
description: The US Federal Trade Commission paused its in-house trial against Microsoft Corp.’s $69 billion acquisition of Activision Blizzard Inc., opening the door to potential settlement talks.

title: Biden Tells Wary Unions That His Clean Energy Agenda Will Bring Jobs
description: President Joe Biden defended his administration’s clean energy agenda, saying it would help create jobs in the US in the face of skepticism from union allies.

title: South America Will Pledge to End Amazon Deforestation by 2030
description: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s ambitious pledge to end illegal deforestation of the Amazon rainforest by 2030 is going regional.

title: Macron Replaces Health, Education Chiefs as Prime Minister Borne Keeps Job
description: French President Emmanuel Macron replaced his health and education ministers as part of a cabinet reshuffle aimed at bringing some fresh impetus to his administration after months of unrest.

title: Sunak Eyes November 2024 as Preferred General Election Timing
description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak is eyeing holding the UK’s next general election in November 2024 in order to allow the economy as much time as possible to recover before going to the polls, according to a person familiar with his thinking.

title: Russian LNG Cargo Was Rejected Over Payment Issue, Argentina’s Enarsa Says
description: Argentina’s state-run energy company Enarsa said a cargo of Russian liquefied natural gas was rejected over a payment issue, raising questions about the viability of similar shipments amid tightening scrutiny over their origin.

title: Trudeau Says Union Reconsidering Offer After Port-Strike Drama
description: Dockworkers might be rethinking their position on a tentative deal after calling off a renewed strike planned for this weekend at Canada’s west coast ports, according to Prime Minister Justin Trudeau.

title: UK Ministers Got at Least £438,000 in Severance in 2022 Turmoil
description: The chaos that enveloped the UK Conservative Party last year as administrations led by prime ministers Boris Johnson and Liz Truss collapsed cost taxpayers at least — and probably more than — £438,000 ($560,000).

title: EU Ready to Boost Links to Turkey But Accession Still Taboo
description: Foreign ministers of the European Union signaled their readiness to work for closer ties with Turkey, while resisting pressure from Ankara to join the bloc.

title: Trump Bashes Biden in New Video as He Seeks United Auto Workers Endorsement
description: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump released a new video attacking President Joe Biden’s environmental policies in a bid to win the endorsement of the powerful auto workers union.

title: EU Adopts New Sanctions Over Iran Military Help to Russia, Syria
description: The European Union adopted new sanctions against Iran over its military support to Russia and Syria, the bloc said in a statement.

title: Peru Says All Road Blockades Have Been Lifted After Day of Protests
description: Peru’s highway authority Sutran said on Thursday morning that all road blockades had been lifted, a day after protests seeking the resignation of President Dina Boluarte were held.

title: Argentina’s Companies Rush to Raise Dollars Before Election Volatility
description: Companies in Argentina are jumping at the chance to refinance their debt at rock-bottom rates as investors brace for more financial volatility before key primary elections next month.

title: GOP Firebrand Lauren Boebert’s House Race Is Now a Toss-Up, Cook Political Says
description: House Republican Lauren Boebert, who barely eked out a victory in 2022, is facing narrowing prospects in 2024, Cook Political Report says in a race ratings update.

title: Putin Foe Navalny Risks Two More Decades in Prison, Allies Say
description: Russian prosecutors at the trial of opposition leader Alexey Navalny are seeking to jail him for 20 more years, according to allies of President Vladimir Putin’s most outspoken critic.

title: Poll Finds 16% Would Consider Backing Joe Manchin on a Third-Party Ticket
description: A new poll finds just 16% of registered voters would consider supporting a fusion third-party ticket with West Virginia Senator Joe Manchin for president, highlighting the uphill path for the Democrat if he were to enter the 2024 race.

title: Biden’s NSA Nominee Warns of Growing Security Threats From AI
description: President Joe Biden’s nominee to lead the National Security Agency warned Thursday of growing threats posed by artificial intelligence, from election interference to the potential export of repressive technologies by China.

title: Sexual Offences Recorded in UK Soar Following High Profile Scandals
description: The number of stalking and harassment offences has rocketed compared to pre-pandemic levels.

title: Italy Strikes Deal With EU to Unlock Third Tranche of Recovery Fund
description: Italy and the European Union have agreed on a deal that will unlock a long overdue third instalment of Recovery Fund cash, with some of the money and targets pushed to the next deadline.

title: Polish Opposition Calls for New Protests After Abortion Scandal
description: Poland’s main opposition party called for fresh protests ahead of fall elections after police searched a woman who said she was suffering from anxiety after taking an abortion pill.

title: Yellen Calls for Resilience Amid Friend-Shoring Trip to Vietnam
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said diversified global supply chains are key to achieving long-term economic resilience, while stressing that the Washington does not seek to build everything in the US and is looking to rely on partners worldwide.

title: Sunak Takes Wind Farm Profits From King Charles to Fund Services
description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak cut the wind farm profits used to finance King Charles III’s household, directing the funds instead to boost the UK’s public finances.

title: Russia Restricts Movements of UK Diplomatic Staff Around Country
description: Russia limited the movements of the United Kingdom’s diplomatic staff around the country in response to what it called the British government’s “hostile actions” against Russian missions.

title: Britain’s £3 Billion Warship Sets Sail After Year in Drydock
description: A £3 billion ($3.9 billion) British aircraft carrier that was stuck in drydock for nearly a year has finally set sail again after overcoming the latest in a series of setbacks.

title: Kenya Proposes Additional Taxes Amid Protests Over High Living Costs
description: Kenya plans to submit a raft of new revenue-generating measures to lawmakers by the end of October to support its fiscal consolidation efforts, even as it encounters protests from citizens against high living costs and separate levies that were introduced earlier this month.

title: India Bans Non-Basmati Rice Exports to Check Local Prices
description: India, the world’s biggest rice exporter, banned shipments of non-basmati white rice to maintain domestic prices at comfortable levels ahead of the general election due in early 2024.

title: Ukraine Warns Ships Heading to Russia Ports Risk Attack
description: Ukraine said that any ships heading to Russian ports may be military targets, in a tit-for-tat response to a warning from Moscow aimed at the country’s grain trade.

title: BRICS Expansion Plan Draws Interest From More Than 40 Nations
description: More than 40 nations have indicated an interest in joining the BRICS bloc of major developing economies as it seeks to expand to grow its political clout, South Africa’s ambassador to the group said.

title: Singapore Says Premier Did Not Hide Information on Minister’s Arrest
description: Singapore has issued a correction order to a blog over the timeline of events surrounding the arrest of a transport minister involved in a graft probe, denying that key politicians concealed information.

title: Top UK Treasury Official Fired by Truss Paid £335,000 Severance
description: The top UK Treasury official sacked by former Prime Minister Liz Truss during her disastrous 7-week tenure last year was paid £335,000 ($432,000) in severance, a government document showed.

title: Billionaire Fighting Sanctions Says He Last Saw Putin at a Funeral in 2007
description: Billionaire Eugene Shvidler said he last saw Russian President Vladimir Putin at a funeral in 2007 as he kicked off his challenge against the UK’s sanctions regime in a London court.

title: A Day of Reckoning for the UK’s Conservatives
description: The UK Conservatives are in a mess. We’re about to see just how bad it is or if there is a ray of hope on the horizon.

title: EU Climate Chief Timmermans Seeks to Lead Left Alliance in Dutch Election
description: European Union climate chief Frans Timmermans plans to return to Dutch politics and run for leadership of the left alliance in a bid to succeed Prime Minister Mark Rutte.

title: Thai Students Join Pita Supporters in Challenging His Ouster
description: Thai students from the nation’s biggest universities called for protests against lawmakers who blocked election winner Pita Limjaroenrat from being nominated for the prime minister’s post, marking growing anger among the people.

title: Johannesburg Residents Urged to Avoid City Center After Blast
description: South African authorities investigating the cause of a massive explosion in Johannesburg’s central business district have warned residents to avoid the area because of the risk of another blast.

title: Billions of Dollars Are Flowing, But Money Alone Can’t Fix US Infrastructure
description: Biden’s urge to claim political dividends from public works projects is running headlong into a local group’s efforts to rebuild lost neighborhoods in Ohio.

title: Twenty Two Nations Apply for BRICS Membership, South Africa Says
description: Twenty two nations have formally applied to become members of the BRICS economic bloc, a South African diplomat said.

title: Ukraine’s Kernel May Need a Year to Fix Chornomorsk Port After Russian Attack
description: Kernel Holding SA, Ukraine’s largest sunflower oil producer, said it may need at least 12 months to restore its facilities at the Chornomorsk port after the July 19 Russian attack.

title: Protesters Storm Swedish Embassy in Iraq Over Koran Burning
description: Protesters stormed the Swedish embassy in Baghdad and set fire to it early Thursday in response to the burning of the Koran in Sweden.

title: Yellen Meets Vietnamese PM as US Friend-Shoring Expands in Asia
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen met with Vietnam’s Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh on Thursday to promote trade ties as part of the Biden administration’s “friend-shoring” push to reshape global supply chains and cut US dependency on China.

title: Serbia Seeks Greater NATO Role in Kosovo to Help Ease Tensions
description: NATO-led peacekeepers should exert more influence in Kosovo to prevent further unrest after recent clashes between protesters and security forces left dozens injured, Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic said.

title: Ukraine Recap: Russia Fires Missiles; EU Ministers Meet
description: Russia fired 19 missiles and 19 Shahed drones in an overnight barrage, the Ukrainian air force said on Telegram. Ukrainian air defense downed five cruise Kalibr and Iskander missiles as well as 13 drones. Missiles were fired from Russian-occupied Crimea, as well as from strategic bombers.

title: Video of Alleged Rape Draws First Comments From Modi on Manipur
description: A video of two women being paraded naked by a group of men in Manipur has elicited first public comments from Prime Minister Narendra Modi regarding the ethnic violence that has engulfed the relatively remote Indian state.

title: China’s Xi Meets ‘Old Friend’ Kissinger Amid Tensions With US
description: President Xi Jinping has welcomed former US Secretary of State Henry Kissinger to Beijing for their first public sit-down in the Chinese capital in four years.

title: Xi’s Private-Sector Propaganda Push Runs Into Wall of Skepticism
description: China’s latest pledges to rebuild a shattered private sector fell flat with investors, underscoring the damage two years of crackdowns and pandemic controls have had on confidence in the world’s second-largest economy.

title: Spain’s Election Frontrunner Heads For a Deal With the Far-Right
description: Alberto Nunez Feijoo leads in the polls for Sunday’s election but will need the support of Vox to form a government

title: The UK Flexes Its Antitrust Power in Microsoft’s Activision Deal
description: The country’s Competition and Markets Authority has positioned itself as the final hurdle for the $69 billion acquisition.

title: Thailand Braces For Protests, Tussle for PM Job as Pita Blocked
description: Thailand is set for more political upheaval after Pita Limjaroenrat was barred by parliament from running for prime minister Wednesday, angering his supporters and opening the door for his coalition partners to seek the top job.

title: Philippines Says US Pledged to Support Its Defense Upgrade
description: The US has committed to further boost the Philippines’ military capabilities, the Southeast Asian nation’s defense chief said, as he vowed to “do everything” to assert the country’s rights in the South China Sea.

title: Videos Appear to Show Protesters Storming Swedish Embassy in Baghdad Over Koran Burning
description: BAGHDAD (AP) — Protesters angered by the burning of a copy of the Quran stormed the Swedish Embassy in Baghdad early Thursday, online videos purported to show.
